Key Arguments: The bill is perceived as a means to protect government and mainstream media from scrutiny.
The bill is not in the best interests of the Australian people.
There is a lack of public forums for discussion on policy.
The existing voluntary industry code has already hindered free discussion.
Main Themes: Criticism of existing media and communication frameworks
Notable Quotes: It should be called what it is - the Censorship and Protection of Propaganda Bill.
The people must be free to speak, and discuss, and argue for the best outcome.
